oop.ex4.data_structures

Class AvlTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • oop.ex4.data_structures.BinarySearchTree
      • oop.ex4.data_structures.AvlTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>

    public class AvlTree
extends oop.ex4.data_structures.BinarySearchTree
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
    This class represents the AVL tree data structure from DAST. This tree is a BST that preserves the height difference property: the difference between each left sub-tree and right sub-tree of a node is at most 1.
    Author:
    orib

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree()
        The default constructor.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(int[] data)
        A constructor that builds the tree by adding the elements in the input array one by one. If a value appears more than once in the list, only the first appearance is added.
        Parameters:
        data - - the values to add to the tree.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(AvlTree avlTree)
        A copy constructor that creates a deep copy of the given AvlTree. This means that for every node or any other internal object of the given tree, a new, identical object is instantiated for the new tree (the internal object is not simply referenced from it). The new tree must contain all the values of the given tree, but not necessarily in the same structure.
        Parameters:
        avlTree - - an AVL tree.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public int contains(int searchVal)
        Check whether the tree contains the given input value.
        Overrides:
        contains in class oop.ex4.data_structures.BinarySearchTree
        Parameters:
        searchVal- - the value to search for.
        Returns:
        the depth of the node (0 for the root) with the given value if it was found in the tree, -1 otherwise.

        Overrides:

      • findMinNodes

        public static int findMinNodes(int h)
        Calculates the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of height h.
        Parameters:
        h - - the height of the tree (a non-negative number) in question.
        Returns:
        the number of minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of the given height.
